title: Time to Vote! Choose the next THROPIC cause - September
body:
Thropic Community - vote below to decide which non-profit will receive the funds we raised this month. The non-profit that receives the most votes by 9/30/21 will receive a percentage of the funds in our charity wallet. 
This is YOUR time to make a difference! 
Learn more about our featured charities below:

Active Minds - Washington D.C. 

Active Minds is a nonprofit organization dedicated to raising mental health awareness among college students, via peer-to-peer dialogue and interaction. Active Minds was founded by Alison Malmon in 2003, after her older brother died by suicide in 2000. A majority of mental illnesses start between ages 14 and 24 when teens and young adults are in school, and suicide is the second leading cause of death for college students. 

Learn more about Active Minds here: https://www.activeminds.org/


American Foundation for Suicide Prevention - Massachusetts 

Established in 1987, the American Foundation for Suicide Prevention (AFSP) is a voluntary health organization that gives those affected by suicide a nationwide community empowered by research, education and advocacy to take action against suicide. The grassroots work that AFSP-MA does focuses on eliminating the loss of life from suicide by: delivering innovative prevention programs, educating the public about risk factors and warning signs, raising funds for suicide research and programs, and reaching out to those individuals who have lost someone to suicide.

Learn more about AFSP-MA here: https://afsp.org/chapter/massachusetts






Samaritans - Boston, Massachusetts

For 47 years, Samaritans has provided lifesaving suicide prevention services in Massachusetts. Samaritans works to prevent suicide and support those who have lost someone to suicide. Each year, 300+ volunteers answer more than 80,000 calls, texts, and chats on our Helpline. Samaritans has also supported 15,000 suicide loss survivors in their grief journeys.

Learn more about Samaritans here: https://samaritanshope.org/



The TAD Project - Newport Beach, California

The TAD Project is an official nonprofit organization, socially driven to increase mental health equity by lowering the barriers to accessing professional, social, and individual mental health support. We do this by creating digital content and providing a community that allows individuals to safely manage mental health crisis situations and more. Their  mission is to help friends and family find the right mental health help through stories, digital tools, and micro-learning.

Learn more about The Tad Project here:  https://thetadproject.org/


*Please note that we tally the votes one-by-one, not by how many thropic coin each voter has.
